recipe_name: Five-spice chicken with ginger and garlic
author: Romy Gill
method: Make a paste from the garlic and ginger in a food blender. Heat the oil in a non-stick pan and add the spices mix. Add the ginger and garlic paste to the pan. Cook on a high heat for 5-6 minutes, or until it turns light brown. Add the ground turmeric, red Kashmiri chilli paste, tomato purée and salt, to taste. Add the boneless chicken and mix well. Cook for 10-15 minutes on a medium heat, or until the chicken is cooked through, stirring occasionally. Serve with plain boiled rice or chapatti.
ingredients: 2 heads of garlic, cloves peeled,  100g/3½oz ginger, peeled,  3 tsp rapeseed oil,  3 tsp five-spice mixture (panch phoron: fenugreek seed, nigella seed, cumin seed, black mustard seed and fennel seed),  1 tsp ground turmeric,  2 tsp red kashmiri chilli paste ,  1 tsp tomato purée,  salt, to taste,  500g/1lb 2oz boneless chicken, cut into pieces,  plain boiled rice or chapatti, to serve
